gamecore.item

Class Weapon

  • java.lang.Object
    • gamecore.item.AbstractItem
      • gamecore.item.Weapon
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    CombatUsable, Item, Usable

    public final class Weapon
extends AbstractItem
implements CombatUsable
    Items of this class can be equiped to an Entity's weapon slot, and delegate the use function to a WeaponType object.
    Author:
    Alex Chythlook

    • Method Detail

      • hashCode

        public int hashCode()
        This implementation of hashCode() takes the hash of the weapons's name string and adds to it a "salt" int, randomly generated at the time of this object's creation. This is so that each weapon is as unique as possible, making sure that Inventory can store multiple instances of otherwise-identical weapons (as weapons are not stackable).
        Overrides:
        hashCode in class AbstractItem

      • getAttackUsing

        public Attribute getAttackUsing()
        Each weapon uses one of the ATK_ attributes to determine its accuracy. Said attribute is stored in the WeaponType object, and called from there.
        Returns:
        The Attribute used by the weapon to determine if each attack was successful.

      • use

        public int use(Entity user,
               Entity target)
        This implementation of use() delates to the Weapon's WeaponType.
        Specified by:
        use in interface Usable
        Parameters:
        user - The Entity using the item.
        target - The desired target of the item. Can be any entity, including the user and the opponent.
        Returns:
        An integer representative of the item's result. For example: a weapon would return the damage it has done to the target, while a health potion would return the amount of health the target has recovered.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class AbstractItem

      • hasCombatTag

        public boolean hasCombatTag(gamecore.adventure.CombatTag tag)
        Description copied from interface: CombatUsable
        Used to check the intended behavior before a CombatUsable object is used.
        Specified by:
        hasCombatTag in interface CombatUsable
        Parameters:
        tag - CombatTag to check against
        Returns:
        If the CombatUsable object has the queried tag, returns true, else false.

      • hasUseTag

        public boolean hasUseTag(UseTag useTag)
        Description copied from interface: Usable
        Use tags are used to determine the context in which this Usable object can be used.
        Specified by:
        hasUseTag in interface Usable
        Parameters:
        useTag - the UseTag to check against.
        Returns:
        True if the Item holds the given UseTag, false if it does not.
